text: The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page.
author: Saint Augustine

text: Not all those who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Traveling – it leaves you speechless, then turns you into a storyteller.
author: Ibn Battuta

text: To travel is to live.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

text: The gladdest moment in human life, methinks, is a departure into unknown lands.
author: Sir Richard Burton

text: Adventure is worthwhile.
author: Aesop

text: Travel makes one modest. You see what a tiny place you occupy in the world.
author: Gustave Flaubert

text: All travel has its advantages. If the passenger visits better countries, he may learn to improve his own. And if fortune carries him to worse, he may learn to enjoy it.
author: Samuel Johnson

text: The life you have led doesn't need to be the only life you have.
author: Anna Quindlen

text: To travel is to discover that everyone is wrong about other countries.
author: Aldous Huxley

text: The world is big and I want to have a good look at it before it gets dark.
author: John Muir

text: I travel not to escape life, but for life not to escape me.
author: Anonymous

text: A journey is best measured in friends, rather than miles.
author: Tim Cahill

text: Travel far enough, you meet yourself.
author: David Mitchell

text: I haven't been everywhere, but it's on my list.
author: Susan Sontag

text: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.
author: Marcel Proust

text: Traveling is like flirting with life. It's like saying, 'I would stay and love you, but I have to go; this is my station.'
author: Lisa St. Aubin de Teran

text: Better to see something once than hear about it a thousand times.
author: Anonymous

text: We travel not to escape life, but for life to escape us.
author: Anonymous

text: Jet lag is for amateurs.
author: Dick Clark

text: If we were meant to stay in one place, we'd have roots instead of feet.
author: Rachel Wolchin

text: Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness.
author: Mark Twain

text: The best education I have ever received was through travel.
author: Lisa Ling

text: Life is short and the world is wide.
author: Simon Raven

text: We travel, some of us forever, to seek other states, other lives, other souls.
author: Anais Nin

text: Traveling is not something you're good at. It's something you do. Like breathing.
author: Gayle Foreman

text: I travel because seeing photos in brochures wasn't good enough for me. It was to be there, that was everything.
author: Wiremu Ratcliffe

text: Adventure may hurt you but monotony will kill you.
author: Unknown

text: Oh, the places you'll go.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page.
author: Saint Augustine

author: J.R.R. Tolkien

author: Wiremu Ratcliffe

text: Adventure may hurt you but monotony will kill you.
author: Unknown

text: Oh, the places you'll go.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: The world is a beautiful place to be explored.
author: Unknown

text: Travel sparks our imagination, feeds our curiosity, and reminds us how much we all have in common.
author: Deborah Lloyd

text: The journey not the arrival matters.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: Traveling is not just seeing the new; it is also leaving behind. Not just opening doors; also closing them behind you, never to return.
author: Unknown

text: The biggest adventure you can ever take is to live the life of your dreams.
author: Oprah Win
